text:
IOWA STATE COLLEGE
OF AGRICULTURE AND MECHANIC ARTS
AMES, IOWA
BROADCASTING STATION WOI
May 27, 1939
Mr. James Ebel
WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Ebel,
Thank you very much for the copy of the tests you are giving
the recording equipment. I think that we shall give most of
these tests to our equipment also just for our own satisfaction.
Our antenna is in operation now. It is a 400* Truscon tower,
shunt excited* At present we have a 2000* line from the trans¬
mitter to the tower. It is a T|M, buried in fiber conduit and
has given us practically no trouble. We had an open circuit
at first due to a poor solder job but we lost no time on the
air because of it.
»5 v, ?.c\
The cmtracts have been for a new R.C.A. Transmitter and
for about $3000 worth of audio equipment, also R.C.A. This will
go into a building which is under construction now. We hope to
be in the new building by about the middle of Seotember. The new
location will shorten our transmission line about 300* .
Our first measurements indicated that we did not have as good
output from the shunt excited tower as we might exoect. We have
improved the coupling system since then, but we have not made any
measurements on the new arrangements. We do not plan to do much
measuring until we get the new equipment installed.
Yours truly,
TO
W. E. Stewart
Chief Engineer - WOI
WES:mo
